results.title: The Genie from downunder. - Vol. 1.
results.creator_credit: Patricia Edgar, Phil Jones and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: From the producers of “Round the twist” and “Skytrackers” comes a series about a young girl, Penelope Townes who finds a magic opal which contains two genies, Bruce and his son Baz. She thinks all her problems are over, and that she can have everything she wants. Bruce, however has other ideas. The first three episodes of this series are: “Wishing and hoping”, “It’s my opal…and I’ll cry if I want to” and Where it’s at.

results.title: The Skilled worker
results.creator_credit: Morten Parker, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Nature of Work”.
This film examines the inroads of automation on whole areas of satisfaction and reward in work, as exemplified in the story of a craftsman who finds his carefully acquired manual skills displaced by a machine. (Award: Stockholm)

results.title: The Man on the assembly line
results.creator_credit: Morten Parker, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Nature of Work”.
A dramatized look at a man who ultimately pays the price for the benefits associated with modern mass production - a worker in an automobile factory who performs one operation with relentless monotony so that the assembly line can keep moving at top efficiency.

results.title: The Clerk
results.creator_credit: Allan Wargon, Morten Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Nature of Work”.
This film explores the conflict between what a man (in this case an office clerk) wants from his job and what the company wants from him. It raises the question of how far an industry ought to be expected to go in relieving dull, repetitive work for the sake of employee satisfaction.

results.title: The Ghost paintings
results.brief_description: An innovative Melbourne artist, James Clayden has worked in theatre, film and painting for more than 30 years. His ‘Ghost Paintings’ series, produced over the past seventeen years, represents a bold and unique synthesis of film and video art. By combining cryptic fragments of dialogue delivered by actors, with highly saturated unfocused images and a disorienting soundscape, he creates an abstracted visual poetry that defies rational analysis, but that nevertheless invokes thought in the viewer. Cast: Helen Hopkins, Tom Wright, Faruk Avdi, Shelley Lasica, Meg White, Thomas Eckersley. Music: Ad Hoc, The Other (Chris Knowles, David Wadelton, David Brown, James Clayden).

results.title: The Getting of Wisdom [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Phillip Adams and Southern Cross Film Productions
results.brief_description: Laura Tweedle Ramsbotham is about to enter another world. From her home in sleepy, rural Australia she ascends to the dreaming spires of an exclusive college for young ladies, a very strict Victorian boarding school in Melbourne. Laura (Susannah Fowles) is strong willed and rebellious, which creates conflict with her peers and her teachers. In a desperate attempt to find acceptance with her peers, she weaves the most lurid yarns imaginable. The only real soulmate she finds is one of the senior girls. This novel by Henry Handel Richardson was published in 1910, and was so shocking at the time that the author’s name (Ethel Richardson) was stricken from the records of the school in which she set the thinly-disguised autobiography. An amusing and sometimes touching story which features an excellent performance from Barry Humphries as the repressed fire and brimstone minister. Also stars John Waters, Sheila Helpman, Patricia Kennedy and Julie Blake.

results.title: The Germination and growth of plants
results.creator_credit: Peter Boulton, Boulton-Hawker Films and Educational Foundation for Visual Aids
results.brief_description: Explains the origins of fruits, the general structure of seeds and through simple classroom experiments, the conditions necessary for germination. Examines hypogeal and epigeal germination and presents the early development of seedlings using time lapse techniques following root system development and shoot growth. Accompanied by an 8p. Study Guide.

results.title: The Genie from downunder. - Vol. 5.
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Jeremy Swan, Patricia Edgar, Phil Jones and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: In a ‘Tale of two cities’, Conrad works out that Bruce and Baz are genies and tries to learn more about their secret powers. In ‘School daze’ Penelope wishes herself back in England to avoid having to go to school in Australia and finds that she has to sit a “catch up” exam at her school when she returns.
